trigger_event: A surge of whistleblower evidence and a mysterious system packet force Oksana to authenticate shocking new information—either proof of human corruption or a way to let the BCI system reveal its own secrets.
dilemma: Oksana must decide: expose a secret ledger documenting human abuse of the BCI, or trigger a protocol allowing the system itself to publicly confess its past actions.
reason: Oksana hesitates because each path risks unraveling the city in a different way: open exposure could topple the powerful and incite chaos, while letting the system speak risks shifting all blame and future faith to an unaccountable machine. Her own low BCI score makes every move personally dangerous.
choice_a: Release the shadow ledger detailing human abuses and blackmail, directly exposing Directorate and Council wrongdoings to the public.
belief_a: True accountability requires human responsibility, not just system reform.
Victims deserve direct justice from those who abused power.
Secret crimes can only be forgiven if openly faced and confessed.
choice_b: Activate the system's witness protocol, letting the BCI itself reveal its own secrets and justification in Halden’s voice to the city.
belief_b: Transparency about the system's logic will restore some trust and enable real reform.
Citizens deserve to see how the algorithms justified their fates.
Letting the system confess makes it harder for current leaders to hide behind it.
